Here is a rewritten version of the passage at the A2 level:

'Paying for trash is a good idea, right? It's good for the environment and the economy. But, it's not that simple. In many countries, people don't pay for taking out the trash. They pay for it through their taxes. But, the cost of taking out the trash is not zero. It costs money to collect and get rid of the trash. If people don't pay for it, they might throw away more trash than they need to.

One way to solve this problem is to make people pay for each bag of trash they throw away. This is called "pay-as-you-throw." Some cities have tried this. In one city in the United States, people had to pay 80 cents for each bag of trash. This might seem like a good idea, but it didn't work as well as expected.

People didn't throw away fewer bags of trash. Instead, they just put more trash in each bag. This is not a good way to reduce trash. The weight of trash collected actually went down by only a little bit.

Some people even started throwing their trash away in secret instead of paying for it. This is a problem. The only good thing that happened was that more people started recycling.

The idea of charging people for their trash is not a bad idea, but it's not that simple. We need to think about other things that affect how much trash people throw away, like how much money they have and how much time they have to recycle. We need to use complex models to understand how these things work together.'<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a rewritten version of the text at the level of A2 CEFR:

Many people are unhappy with their work. They feel like they are not respected or appreciated. Just being good at a job is not enough. People want to be happy and fulfilled in their work. This is because work should not just be about making money, but about being a good person.

Some jobs are not as fulfilling as they used to be. For example, doctors are often stressed and unhappy with their work. Accountants are worried about the ethics of their profession. Architects are not able to use their imagination as much as they would like. Managers are often stuck in bureaucracy.

The problem is that people are not happy with their jobs because they are not treated as individuals. They are seen as machines that can be used to make money. This is not good for people's mental and physical health.

Some people are trying to change this. They want to find ways to make work more fulfilling. They want to make sure that people are happy and respected in their jobs.

For example, hotels could be more than just places to sleep. They could be cultural centers where people from different countries meet and learn from each other. Hotel staff could be given more responsibility and autonomy, and could work together to create a welcoming and respectful environment for guests.

Work should be a relationship between people, not just a way to make money. People should be able to design their own jobs and work with people they like and respect. This would make work more enjoyable and fulfilling.

Good communication is important for this to happen. It's not just about talking, but about really listening to each other and understanding each other's perspectives. This can create a sense of equality and respect between people, and can make the world a better place.<|eot_id|>

nd_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

"BROADCASTING: How Technology Shaped Our Lives

The word 'broadcasting' comes from the idea of spreading seeds widely. It's a metaphor that means spreading something to many people. This idea was used when television was first invented. People thought it would be a way to share information and entertainment with many people at the same time.

Television was a new technology that could send words and pictures to many people at once. It was like a big family gathering where everyone could watch the same thing. This idea of a big, central gathering was popular because it fit with the way people lived and worked in the 20th century.

There were some alternative ideas for how television could work, but they didn't become popular. Some people thought that television could be a two-way communication tool, like a phone or a letter. But in the end, the idea of a centralised broadcasting system won out.

This system was popular because it fit with the way people lived and worked. As people moved to cities and became more connected to the world, they wanted to stay informed and entertained. Television was a way to do that.

The idea of broadcasting is still important today, but it might change in the future. Maybe we'll use different words to describe how we share information and entertainment. For now, broadcasting is a way to spread ideas and stories to many people at once."<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a simplified version of the text, suitable for a learner of English at the A2 level:

Some people feel that they are never happy, no matter how many things they have. This is because they are trying to buy happiness. Advertisers try to make us feel like we need things we don't really need. They make us feel bad if we don't have something. If we don't buy things, we feel like we are not good enough.

We see many advertisements every day. We see them on TV, on the radio, in newspapers, magazines, and on the internet. They all tell us to buy things. Some people spend a lot of time studying caves. They want to know where they come from and how they work. Caves are interesting and people want to learn more about them.

Weather forecasting is important. Many people used to watch the sky and predict the weather. Now we have special machines that can do this for us. But we still need people to help us understand the weather. They use computers and satellites to get the information. But we still need people to make sense of it all.

I changed the text by:

* Using simpler vocabulary
* Shortening the sentences
* Removing complex ideas and concepts
* Using more concrete examples
* Removing technical terms and jargon
* Making it more conversational and easy to understand.<|eot_id|>

end_header_id|>
Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

'Music and Theatre

I used to think that opera is mainly a type of theatre. But after working at an opera house, I realized that music is more important. This makes sense. But I come from the world of theatre, where words and actors are most important. In theatre, there is no one directing the actors once the show starts, and the actors and audience speak the same language.

When you go to a music concert or opera, some people don't understand the music. They might feel embarrassed or amazed by how good the musicians are. Even if they don't know much about music, they can still appreciate the skill of the performers. It's like watching a sports game - we know athletes work hard to be good, and we admire their skills.

Theatre audiences are different. They don't always understand how actors learn their lines or do their job. They might not be impressed by a long speech. But this doesn't mean they are not generous or demanding. They just have different expectations.

I think music could learn from theatre about how to make the audience feel more involved. Music is already a performance that can be emotional and exciting. But sometimes the way music is presented can feel too formal or hierarchical. This can make the audience feel like they are not part of the performance.

There are people working to make music more accessible and fun for everyone. I want to see more of this. I love both theatre and music, and I think they can both be amazing. I want more people to enjoy them like I do.'

Note: I have simplified the language, reduced the number of complex sentences, and removed some of the more abstract ideas to make it more accessible to a learner of level A2. I have also kept the main ideas and arguments of the original text, but presented them in a clearer and more concise way.<|eot_id|>

nd_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

I don't like sand when it's not used to make things like glass and concrete. When it's natural, it's a problem. It gets in my face and in my food. It also sticks to me when I'm wet. But when I sit on a towel or go into a car, it falls off. It's strange. Sand stays with me for a long time. I don't like it.

Many people want to feel safe and secure in their homes. This is why we have locks and keys. We like the feeling of turning a key in a lock. Some companies have tried to make electronic locks, but people prefer the old way.

I was worried about visiting the new art museum because I don't understand modern art. I like some of it, like pictures with animals and bright lights. But I don't know what most of it means. The museum has labels that explain what the art is about. This helps me understand the pictures. Before, I just stared at them. Now, I can learn more about them.

Note: I have simplified the vocabulary, sentence structure, and language to make it more accessible to a learner of level A2. I have also removed some of the more complex ideas and concepts to make the text more manageable for a beginner.<|eot_id|>

nd_header_id|>
Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

Making Movies into Films

When we make a movie based on a book, we have to change some things. This can be hard for the writer, but it can also be interesting. I worked on a script and I saw that I could take out a lot of the dialogue and description from the book and still get the same message across. This doesn't mean that the original dialogue and description were not important. It's just that the way we tell a story in a book is different from the way we tell it in a movie.

Movies can be very entertaining. We can feel like we are part of the story and forget about our everyday problems. But when the movie is over, we go back to our normal lives. We don't feel responsible for the time we spent watching the movie.

The film studios where movies are made can be confusing. There are many small rooms with the same furniture, and it's hard to find the right one. But people who work there know where everything is, so it's not a problem for them.

Many people want to make movies. They read books about how to do it and take classes at university. Some people even make movies with just a small camera and a low budget. One director, Robert Rodriguez, made a movie for just $7,000 and became famous.

In the past, movie directors had to work for a long time before they could make a big movie. They started by working behind the scenes and making smaller movies. But now, with the help of technology, people can make movies more easily.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a rewritten version of the text at a level suitable for A2 learners:

When I was a child, I lived in a place called West Earlham. The houses there were old and not very nice. They were made of orange brick or white stucco. In the summer, a strong smell from a factory came from far away and made the air smell bad. The streets were dirty and the houses were close together.

I remember sitting on a chair near a window and looking at the houses going away into the distance. I also remember my mother ironing clothes in a back room. She was a small, strict woman who was often angry. I never knew why she was angry, so I couldn't make her happy.

My mother was a solitary person who liked to be alone. She was very particular about how we behaved and what we did. For example, she didn't want us to play in our neighbors' gardens or touch their flowers. She also didn't like us to make noise or be late.

As I grew older, I met some of my mother's friends. They were also strict and didn't like to talk much. They would talk about things like the weather and how hard life was. They didn't like children and didn't want to play with us.

When I was young, I used to play at home all day. I would play on a rug in the living room while my mother sat in an armchair. When I was five, I started going to school. I had to walk there with other children from my street. My mother didn't have a bike, so she would send me with other kids.

I remember the summer holidays when we would go on trips to the city. We would see old men who told us stories about their adventures. We also went to a charity fair once where we got lemonade and tried to win prizes. My mother didn't like the idea of charity because she thought people were only doing it to get money.

My mother didn't like politicians and thought they were mean. She thought they were only looking out for themselves. I don't think she was a very nice person, but she tried to teach me things. Sometimes she would take me to the museum on Sundays. We would walk around and look at paintings. She wasn't very interested, but she liked to pretend to be. One time, she made a joke about a painting of a Roman soldier. I remember it as the only time she tried to be funny.

Note: I have removed complex vocabulary, sentence structures, and themes to make the text more accessible to A2 learners. I have also reorganized the text to make it easier to follow and understand.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A2:

I walked down Philadelphia Avenue on the side with odd-numbered houses. It was getting dark and the air was humid and wet. I knew this street from when I was a child. I used to play with my friends who lived in the houses here. The houses looked different now, with new iron railings instead of wooden ones. Some of the old shops had become homes again. I wondered how people lived in these spaces.

I visited a friend who lives in a big, old warehouse. He didn't want a big, open space, so he put up a big piece of plastic to divide the room. He wanted a kitchen in the middle of his flat where he could cook for his friends or work with clients. He also wanted to hide his office and make a hallway.

Bruce Chatwin was a famous writer who loved to travel. He wrote a book about his adventures in Patagonia. His writing was imaginative and exciting. He liked to make things up to make his stories more interesting.

I went for a swim in my pool during a big rainstorm. The rain made the water bubbly and fun. I wanted to swim all the way to the sea, following the rain as it flowed across the country. I wanted to get away from the usual routine and explore the world in a new way.

Most of us live in a world where everything is labeled and explained. But sometimes it's good to get off the beaten track and do things on our own. Swimming, walking, and cycling are good ways to do this. They help us feel connected to nature and the world around us.

Note: I simplified the vocabulary, sentence structure, and content to make it more accessible to a learner of level A2. I also removed some of the more complex ideas and sentences to make it easier to understand.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text:

Charles Darwin thought that people cry for no reason. But scientists now think that crying is important for our social relationships. When we cry, we show others that we need help or support. This helps people feel closer to each other. Crying can also show that we care about someone who is suffering. Sometimes we cry because we are sad or moved by something, like a sad movie or a beautiful song. We might cry more when we are with others than when we are alone. Crying is an important way to show our emotions and connect with others.

Note: I used simpler vocabulary and sentence structures to make the text more accessible to a learner of English at the A2 level. I also removed some complex ideas and phrases to make the text easier to understand.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

The Earth is getting warmer. This is called global warming. We know it's happening, but we're not sure how much warmer it will get or what will happen to our lives. The weather will change, and this will affect the plants, animals, and water. Humans use natural resources like plants, water, and soil to live. We need to be careful with these resources. 

We know that humans have been putting more gases into the air, which makes the Earth warmer. This is making the climate change. But we don't know exactly how much it will change or what will happen. Scientists are trying to predict what will happen. They use computers to do this. 

The predictions say that the Earth will get warmer, and this will cause problems. The weather will be more extreme, like really hot days, floods, and droughts. This will affect where we live, how we grow food, and how we get water. Some places will get more rain, and some will get less. This will be a problem for many people. 

Some good things might happen, like crops growing better in some places. But many bad things will happen too. The sea level will rise, and this will flood many cities and homes. Many people will have to leave their homes and move to other places. This will be very difficult for them. 

The consequences of global warming will be very serious. We need to take care of the Earth and reduce the gases we put into the air to slow down global warming.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

'Going to Mars: We are looking for a married couple to go on a long trip to Mars. The trip will take 501 days. The couple must be strong and healthy. This will be the first time people go to Mars. A rich man named Dennis Tito wants to send a special capsule to Mars on January 5, 2018. The capsule will go high above Mars and then use Mars' gravity to come back to Earth. This is important because it will save fuel. The next time Mars and Earth are close together is in 2031, so we have to hurry. We are trying to make new technologies to make this trip possible. Even if we don't make it to Mars, we will still learn a lot and make progress for future trips.'<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

'Art is a special kind of product that can be difficult to understand because it is often separate from the things that happen in our everyday lives. When we think of art, we often think of paintings, buildings, or statues that are kept in museums or galleries. But art is not just about these objects; it's about how they make us feel and think. 

When we look at art, we often get caught up in the beauty of the object itself and forget about the people and experiences that created it. This can make it hard to understand what the art is really about. 

To understand art better, we need to think about how it connects to our everyday lives. We need to look at the ordinary things that happen around us and see how they are connected to the art. 

For example, we might enjoy a beautiful sunset or a good movie without thinking about the science behind it. But if we want to really understand why we enjoy it, we need to think about the natural world and the people who created the movie. 

Many people enjoy things like movies, music, and comics, but they might not think of them as "art". But these things can be just as important as traditional art forms like painting and music. 

The key to understanding art is to see how it connects to our everyday lives and experiences. When we do this, we can appreciate art in a deeper way and understand what it's really about.'

Note: I have used simpler vocabulary and sentence structures to make the text more accessible to a learner of level A2. I have also tried to break down complex ideas into smaller, more manageable chunks.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a rewritten version of the passage at the A2 level:

Lions are often seen as amazing hunters. They work together to catch their prey. They are like a team, working together to get their food. But, after studying lions for a long time, we have a different idea. We thought that lions would work together to hunt, take care of their babies, and scare away other lions. But, it seems that sometimes working together doesn't help. If one lion is too kind, the others might take advantage of it. So, why do lions still work together?

We thought we would find the answer in a few years, but it took a long time. Lions can live up to 18 years, so it took a while to figure out why they behave in certain ways.

The second passage is about a band called Bedrock. They made a new kind of music that was different from what was popular before. Their music was more fun and had a mix of different styles. The band was good at writing songs and they were able to make music that people enjoyed.

The third passage is about a person who likes to travel. They like to visit old places and learn about history. They didn't like to travel to new places, but they liked to learn about the past. When they wrote a travel book, they chose to write about old places that were interesting to them.

The last passage is about writing a book. When you send your book to a publisher, it goes to a special place where people look at it. If they like it, they will show it to someone more important. The person who likes your book will have to convince others that it's good and that you are a good writer.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a rewritten version of the text at a level suitable for A2 learners:

**Advertising in Trouble**

In the early 1990s, advertising agencies faced a difficult time. The economy was not doing well, and many businesses were struggling. This meant that advertising agencies had to work with smaller budgets and make do with less. 

Advertising people felt under a lot of pressure because they were responsible for making sure their clients' businesses were successful. They had to come up with good ideas and make sure they worked well. 

At the same time, many people were questioning whether advertising was really effective. They wanted to know what they got for their money and whether it was worth it. 

This made it hard for advertising agencies to do their job. They had to find ways to make their clients happy with less money. 

There were also other challenges, such as changing consumer habits and new laws about advertising. 

The article says that it's hard to find good information about how to do advertising well because companies are too busy trying to survive and don't want to share their secrets. 

Note: I have simplified the language, shortened the sentences, and removed complex vocabulary and phrases to make it more accessible to A2 learners. I have also tried to keep the main ideas and structure of the original text.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

"When I was at university, I decided to become a chef. My friends thought it was an unusual choice. Cooking is not a popular job. It's hard work, and the pay is not good. But I didn't care. I was unhappy at university. The work was hard, and the social life was boring. Being a chef seemed like a good way to escape. It was a way to do something serious and important.

I first saw the beauty of cooking when I ate at a famous restaurant. The food was amazing. I felt happy and warm for days after. After that, I wanted to learn more about cooking. I read cookbooks, went to markets, and made big meals. I learned by doing.

I also learned to dive. The instructor was strict, but I practiced until I got it right. It was fun to jump off the board and feel like I was flying. When I got out of the water, I felt happy and free.

Some people like to travel and take risks. They go on big adventures and face challenges. We might think they are strange, but they are just doing what they like.

I like to sail, but I'm not good at it. I like to write about sailing because it's exciting. I use a special device to find my way on the water. Some people think this device is helpful, but I think it's bad because it takes away from the connection with the sea. I like to look at the waves and feel the sea, not just use a device to navigate."

Note: I simplified the text by:

* Reducing the vocabulary to more basic words and phrases
* Shortening the sentences and paragraphs to make them easier to understand
* Removing complex ideas and concepts
* Using simpler sentence structures and grammar
* Focusing on the main ideas and themes of the text<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a rewritten version of the text at the A2 level:

Summer is a time when we can relax and enjoy our favorite books. Reading can help us feel more at home in the world. We can connect with the stories of others and find our own thoughts and feelings reflected in them. This can be especially true when we read books written by people from different places and times.

When we travel, we can also discover new things and meet new people. Our eyes are open to new sights and sounds, and we can learn from our experiences. Reading can have a similar effect, opening our minds to new ideas and perspectives.

The author of this text has written about his own travels and experiences. He has shared his thoughts and feelings with us, and we can learn from his stories. He also talks about the concept of "ecotourism," which means traveling in a way that is good for the environment and respects local cultures.

The author has also written about his journey to Transylvania, where he stayed in different homes and met many people. He kept a journal, but sometimes he didn't write as much as he should have. He is now writing about his experiences, but he is not worried about getting everything exactly right. He wants to share his story with us and help us learn from his adventures.

Note: I have simplified the language, reduced the complexity of the sentences, and removed some of the more advanced vocabulary and concepts to make it accessible to A2 level learners.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text, suitable for A2 level learners:

Fashion is often seen as a modern thing that started in the 19th and 20th centuries. But, actually, fashion has a long history. Historians say that fashion started when people began to trade and buy and sell things. As societies grew and more people were born, people needed more clothes and ways to make them. This made fashion important and meaningful.

Now, it's hard to know what something means just by looking at it. For example, a man's suit can mean different things to different people in different situations.

As for writers, many of us have to work part-time jobs to make a living. Some write in the evenings and have other jobs. Others, like me, do odd jobs like teaching and writing articles. We make do with what we have and are often helped by friends and family.

Suddenly, our band became famous. We were playing in small places and they were all selling out. We had to sneak in and out of the venues to avoid being mobbed by fans. We couldn't even leave the house without being followed by fans. We were treated like celebrities, and our needs were taken care of. I was shy, but I became more confident. I was out of my depth, but it was an amazing experience.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is a simplified version of the text, suitable for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

Music - A Changing World

Music is a big part of our lives. We can listen to it on the radio, TV, CDs, and the internet. But this has changed the way we experience music. There are fewer live concerts and less work for professional musicians.

In the past, people could listen to music on the radio, TV, records, and tapes. Now, we have many more ways to listen to music. This has made music more accessible, but it has also changed the way we think about music.

Music is important for many people. It brings people together and makes us happy. We can learn to play musical instruments, which is good for our brains and can help us make friends.

In the future, music will continue to change. We will have new kinds of music and new ways to make music. We will also see more people playing instruments and singing together.

To prepare for this change, music teachers will need to adapt. They will need to teach people of all ages and backgrounds how to play different instruments. They will also need to be good communicators and able to work with many different people.

It's important for everyone involved in music to work together to make music more important and valued. We need to remind people how important music is in our lives.

Note: I've used simpler vocabulary, shorter sentences, and a more straightforward structure to make the text more accessible to a level A2 learner. I've also removed some technical terms and jargon to make the text easier to understand.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of English at level A2:

Some people don't like actors. They think actors are pretending to be someone else. But actors know that acting is not just pretending. It's about feeling the emotions and thoughts of the character.

A famous actor named Pavlova said, "If I could tell you, I wouldn't dance it." This means that some things are better left unspoken.

Another famous actor, Paul Scofield, said that an actor's work is only interesting when they are performing. When they talk about their work, it becomes boring.

There was a play called Hamlet. The actor who played Hamlet, Adrian Lester, was very good. He was like a young man who was trying to become a man. He used his body and voice to show his emotions.

Acting is not just about pretending. It's about finding the feelings and thoughts of the character. It's like finding the right words to say.

A director of a play has a special way of working with actors. They call it "dropping in". The actors sit quietly while someone else is speaking, and then they think about what it means to them. They find the reason to speak, and then they speak.

The perfect theatre is one that makes you feel like you're part of it. The actors and the audience should feel connected. The theatre should be designed in a way that makes you feel like you're close to the action.

Not every play is for everyone. You can't guess what people will like. When you go to the theatre, you want to see something new and exciting.

Note: I've simplified the vocabulary, sentence structure, and concepts to make it accessible to a learner of English at level A2. I've also removed some of the more complex ideas and examples to make it easier to understand.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

'Rock and roll music in the 1950s was popular among young people, but it also affected older people. It helped create a new kind of music that future rock stars listened to and loved. Paul Simon, a young musician, listened to a radio show called Moondog Rock'n'Roll Party. This show was very popular among young people who loved rock and roll. Paul Simon was inspired by the music and wanted to make his own music. He thought it would be okay if he took his time and was careful. But sometimes, things don't go as planned. Paul Simon got stuck in a hole in the snow while walking. He had to get out of the hole and find a new way to continue his journey. He sat under a pine tree to think about what to do next.

Qualitative Research

There are many books about how to do qualitative research, but they often don't explain how to analyze the data. Many people are not sure how researchers analyze their data. We asked some social scientists who have done qualitative research to share their experiences. We wanted to understand how they analyzed their data and make it clear for others. This is not an easy task. We gave them the freedom to write about their experiences in different ways, like writing a story or writing in a more formal way.'

Note: I simplified the text by:

* Using shorter sentences and simpler vocabulary
* Removing complex sentences and rephrasing them into simpler ones
* Removing technical terms and jargon related to research
* Focusing on the main ideas and removing unnecessary details
* Using more concrete and relatable examples (e.g. Paul Simon getting stuck in a hole in the snow)<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

Some time ago, I saw my six-year-old son eating noodles in a funny way. He was using his teeth to pull them up and acting like a little dinosaur. I asked him about dinosaurs and he didn't know much. There is a lot of talk about using computers and the internet to learn, but is it a good way? One writer tried an interactive program with his son. The father read the words while the son played with the pictures. The father thought his son might have learned something if he had read a book instead.

Television is a good way to learn, but it's not as good as learning with a teacher or parent. We can use new technology to help our children learn, but we also need to use traditional ways of learning.

Hollywood is a famous place in America that makes many movies. It was once a small town, but now it is a big city. People who live and work there talk a lot about movies and the people who make them.

Photography is a way to take pictures. It was invented a long time ago by artists who wanted to take pictures of the world. Some people thought photography was not an art, but photographers knew it was.

Book illustration is the art of drawing pictures for books. In the past, it was common to have pictures in children's books. Some of these pictures are very valuable and will be shown again in the future.

Note: I have simplified the vocabulary, sentence structure, and grammar to make it accessible to a learner of level A2. I have also removed some complex ideas and examples to make the text more manageable for a beginner.<|eot_id|>

nd_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

Some people write about their lives on the internet. They share photos and stories. But this can be dangerous. We need to be careful what we share. 

A long time ago, a website warned people about sharing their whereabouts online. It said that if you share where you are, you are also telling everyone else. This can be scary. 

Some people have been sharing their lives online for a long time. They are called bloggers. They share their thoughts and feelings with the world. 

One blogger, Justin Hall, started sharing his life online in 1994. He wrote about his life, his feelings, and his photos. He was very open. 

But one day, he had a problem. He fell in love, but his girlfriend didn't like him sharing their life online. She said either he stopped blogging or she would leave him. He stopped blogging. 

Another blogger, Heather Armstrong, had a problem too. She wrote about her job, but her boss didn't like it. Her boss sent her blog to all the important people at work, and she lost her job. 

These stories show us that we need to be careful what we share online. We can't say everything online that we would say in person. Our online life is connected to our real life. If we are not careful, we can make big mistakes. 

Heather Armstrong learned this lesson. She stopped blogging for a while, but then she started again. She wrote about her new family and became a famous blogger. She learned that we can share our lives online, but we need to be smart about it.<|eot_id|>

**How to Write Poetry**

Writing poetry is like playing a game. You need to be careful and spontaneous. If you make a mistake, it can ruin everything. So, I will not give you rules. Instead, I will tell you that the most important thing is to read a lot, write a lot, and let your imagination run free.

When writing a short story, you need to be careful not to have too many characters or too much talking. You should only use flashbacks if they help the story. You can use dialogue to make the story more interesting.

Writing a screenplay is like playing chess. You need to think ahead and make a plan. You can't always see what will happen next, but that's okay.

**Language**

Language is a natural part of being human. We all learn to talk without trying. But writing is different. It's not natural for humans to write. We need to learn how to write and understand how it works.

**Oral History**

When historians talk to people who lived in the past, they have to be careful. What people say may not be completely true. The person being interviewed may not remember things correctly, or they may be influenced by what others have told them. Even the historian asking the questions can affect what the person says. The historian's job is to be honest and careful when collecting information.

**Animal Science**

There are two main ways to study animals. Some people focus on how animals' bodies work, like how their muscles and nerves work together. Others study animals in their natural habitats and how they behave.

Some scientists who study animals in the lab focus on how animals learn. Others study animals in the wild and how they behave naturally. Both ways are important, and they can help us learn more about animals.

**Social Sciences**

When you start studying social sciences, you need to learn two things at the same time. You need to learn about the subject and how to do research. Social sciences are not just common sense; they have their own special ways of thinking and studying.

**Classical Architecture**

In ancient Greece and Rome, architecture was not just about building houses. It was an art that included things like order, proportion, and symmetry. The ancient Greeks and Romans believed that architecture should be beautiful and pleasing to the eye.

The history of classical architecture is complex. People built simple houses and huts long before the Greeks and Romans built their famous temples and buildings. These early buildings had their own style and form, which influenced the way the Greeks and Romans built later.

Here is a simplified version of the text, adapted for a learner of English at the A2 level (CEFR):

**Heritage**

Heritage is important because it helps people feel connected to the past. We often feel connected to our own family heritage, but it's also important to learn about our national heritage. This helps us understand our past and our future. Heritage is like a connection to our ancestors, and it makes us feel part of something bigger than ourselves.

**The Fens**

I wrote a book about a place called the Fens in England. It's a special place that is both familiar and strange. The Fens are flat and empty, but also full of history and mystery. I didn't need to visit the Fens to write about them because I used my imagination.

**Museums**

Museums should make their collections easy to understand and accessible to everyone. This means using displays that are interesting and interactive. Museums are special because they show us real objects from the past, not just copies or replicas. They help us connect with the past and understand our history.

**Architecture and Environment**

We all want to preserve things, especially when our towns are changing quickly. This makes some people want to keep everything the same, while others think about the future of our towns. It's important for planners to consider our feelings about change and to find ways to make it work.

They are usually short and are only in the newspaper for a day or a week. Some people think that reviewing is not a important job because it's not as prestigious as writing a novel or a serious book. However, reviewing is a skilled job that requires a lot of thought and effort.

A reviewer needs to think about who their audience is and what they want to say. They also need to write clearly and simply so that people can understand what they're saying. A reviewer should know a lot about a lot of things and be able to write in a way that's easy to understand.

Some reviewers, like the American novelist John Updike, enjoy writing reviews and collecting them in books. Others may not be as proud of their reviews and prefer to focus on their main work.

In the English-speaking world, it's common for academics to also write reviews. This is because many academics are also good writers and can write reviews that are helpful to readers. In fact, writing reviews can be a good way for academics to share their knowledge with a wider audience and to make sure that their work is understood by people who may not be experts in their field.

Overall, writing reviews is a important job that requires skill and effort. It's not just about writing a few sentences quickly, but about sharing knowledge and opinions with others.<|eot_id|>

Here is a rewritten version of the text at the A2 level:

Birds have always been important in human culture. We love them, fear them, and even worship them. But what does this say about us? 

In my garden, I hear a strange noise coming from the greenhouse. It's a small brown bird, a wren, bouncing around the glass. Is it trying to tell me something? Or is it just stuck in there?

Wrens have been important in British culture for a long time. In the past, people believed that the direction a wren flew in would tell them their luck. Today, we still see wrens in pictures and ceramics in many British homes. The wren is a special bird in our culture and in our hearts. A forest without wrens is a sad place.

People have a special connection with many birds, especially when we live close to nature. We use stories and legends to understand the world around us. This connection is important because it helps us understand our place in the world.

The red kite is a good example. Long ago, people in London loved to see these birds flying overhead, taking bread from children's hands. But soon, people started to see them as pests and they almost disappeared. Now, we are trying to bring them back.

Our relationship with birds is not just cultural. It goes back to when humans first lived on Earth. We have always been fascinated by birds because they can fly and sing. This is a reminder of our own identity and our connection to nature.

Some people might say that our feelings about birds are old-fashioned and not important anymore. But they are still a part of us. That's why birds are important indicators of the health of our environment.

Many birds are in danger, and this is not just a problem for the birds themselves, but also for our culture. The skylark, turtle dove, and lapwing are all special birds that carry a lot of meaning. When we lose these birds, we lose a part of our culture and our history.

Folklore is important because it helps us connect with the world around us. The stories we tell about birds are not just about science, but about our feelings and emotions. When we watch birds, we are not just observing them, we are also learning about ourselves.<|eot_id|>

Maps help us understand the relationships between places and things on the Earth's surface. These relationships are based on distance and direction. Even today, some maps, like those showing train routes, don't show directions clearly.

In the past, important landmarks along a route were marked with signs. These signs were different sizes to show how important they were. The way maps were made changed over time. Cartographers (map makers) used new ideas and tools to make maps more accurate and detailed. They used science to help them, like the magnetic compass to find direction.

As people explored the world, they discovered that the Earth is not a perfect sphere. This changed how maps were made. The people who used maps also changed. Travelers, merchants, soldiers, and scientists all needed maps for different reasons. Cartographers had to make maps that worked for everyone.

Today, cartographers make maps for many different purposes. They show things like where people live, what the climate is like, and where different types of rocks are found. This is because maps are important for many sciences. Cartographers have to use new ideas and tools to make better maps. Sometimes, old ideas stay around for a while before new ones come along. Maps are important because they show us how people thought and lived in the past. Studying old maps is fascinating and helps us learn about history.

D. The Cambridge University Collection of Air Photographs

This collection has over 400,000 photographs taken from airplanes. The university has its own plane and takes pictures of the landscape all over Britain. The photos show how the land has changed over time. We have a small display and the staff can help you with questions. You can buy copies of the photos, but you can't borrow the originals.

E. Cambridge Medieval Brass Rubbing Centre

This is a special place where you can make copies of old brass plates from medieval tombs. You can make wall hangings by rubbing the plates. The centre has made copies of the original plates so we can preserve them. The brass plates were a way to remember important people in the past. Most of the original plates were destroyed, but we have many left in Britain and can see them here.

I had a special time in my life when I didn't have a summer for nine years. I would go to New Zealand every winter and stay there for three months. I liked the idea of planting trees. I had worked on farms in Australia before and enjoyed it. My family was also excited about the project. We planted 70 acres of land in 1968. It was a difficult time because it rained a lot, but we were happy to be planting trees.

I had a friend who knew how to plant trees, which was helpful. We had to make sure the trees were planted in a straight line. It was hard to do, but we got better at it.

I like physical work, and planting trees made me strong. After a while, I could plant trees easily. I would think about my life and the world while I was working. I started to think about how we can take care of the earth.

I went back to New Zealand a few times to see the trees grow. It was nice to see how they were doing. Sometimes, I would read about bad weather in New Zealand in the news and feel worried. But the trees are doing well now.

I took a break from teaching and went back to New Zealand alone for three months in 1984. I wrote my first book there. I would write in the morning, work on the trees in the afternoon, and do research in the evening. I feel very connected to that place and the earth. It's a special bond.<|eot_id|>

We have a farm in Somerset, England. My husband and I turned it into an 'open farm' six years ago. We take care of orphaned animals. One day, some workers brought us three baby badgers. They were very small and cold. We named them Primrose, Bluebell, and Willow. We took care of them and fed them milk from a bottle. We also had to clean them to get rid of fleas.

At first, we had to feed them every four hours. But after a week, they started drinking from a bottle on their own. They were very happy and playful. We would take them on walks at night, and they would chase each other and play.

But one of the cubs, Willow, got sick and died. We were very sad. Later, we found another baby badger, Willow II, and took care of him too.

As the cubs grew, we started giving them solid food, like cereals and fruits. They loved it! They would eat and play all day. We would take them on walks at night, and they would chase each other and play some more.

One day, we built a special home for the badgers. It had tunnels and a big enclosure. They loved it! They would play and explore all day. We would visit them at night, and they would come to say hello.

Now, the badgers are grown up and have their own territory. We don't see Primrose as much, but Bluebell and Willow II still come to visit us. They are happy and healthy, and we are happy to see them.<|eot_id|>

Every summer, peacocks in Whipsnade Wild Animal Park show off their beautiful tails to the hens. This is a mystery that has puzzled scientists for a long time. How did these birds evolve such a fancy feature? It's not easy to understand why they didn't just develop something more practical. 

A scientist named Marion Petrie and her team are trying to solve this mystery. They are studying the peacocks at Whipsnade because they live in a special place where they are free to roam, but are still used to people. The team wants to know two things: do the hens really choose the peacocks with the most beautiful tails? And do these peacocks have some special quality that helps them survive, or is it just for show?

The team has been watching the peacocks and taking pictures. They found that the hens do like the peacocks with the most eye-spots on their tails. But they still don't know if these peacocks are also healthier or stronger than the others.

One scientist, William Hamilton, thinks that showy birds are often healthier because they don't get sick as easily. But the team at Whipsnade can't check this for the peacocks. They are going to study the babies of the peacocks and see if they grow faster or are healthier if their dads have beautiful tails.

There is another idea called "Fisher's Runaway" that might explain how the peacocks got their tails. It's like a cycle: a hen picks a peacock with a slightly better tail, and then their babies inherit the tail and also like long tails. This cycle makes the peacocks' tails get longer and longer over time. This idea might prove that the hens are choosing "beauty for beauty's sake".<|eot_id|>

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

'Natural Talents

Humans and animals are very similar. In fact, we are almost the same as chimpanzees. This means that what makes us different from animals must be a recent development. Our bodies and brains are not very different from those of animals. So, what makes us human? 

Some people think that our art is what makes us different. But, animals also make art. Chimpanzees use sticks to eat and to protect themselves. They even make simple paintings. So, what is the difference between human art and animal art? 

Some people say that human art is not useful. It is not like the art that animals make to help them survive. Human art is made for pleasure. This is true, but animals might also make art for pleasure. We can't ask animals if they enjoy their art, but we can see that they make it.

Another difference is that humans learn to make art. We learn from each other and from our parents. Animals, on the other hand, are born with the ability to make their art. For example, some birds are born with the ability to sing a certain song. 

But, there is a problem. Some animals, like chimpanzees, can also learn to make art. They can make paintings and drawings. And, some of their paintings are even sold! This makes us question what makes human art different. 

In the end, the differences between human art and animal art are not as big as we thought. Both humans and animals make art for pleasure, and both learn to make it. The only difference might be that humans make more complex art and learn to make it in different ways.'<|eot_id|>

Some people are called eccentrics because they don't follow the usual rules. But what is normal? We all have things that make us different. Maybe you like to collect stamps or play a weird sport. Being eccentric means being yourself and not caring what others think.

Most of us want to fit in and be liked by others. We also want to be different and stand out. This can be a problem because we often feel like we have to choose between being ourselves and being like everyone else. Some people join groups or clubs to be with others who like the same things. This makes them feel better.

We all have a mix of wanting to be the same as others and wanting to be different. We might pretend to be like everyone else, but deep down we want to be ourselves. Publisher A Reviews are very important for us. People often buy books because of good reviews. In fact, a study found that people buy books because of reviews more often than because of ads or word of mouth.

Here is a simplified version of the text at the A2 level:

I remember the day I met Picasso. I was 18 years old and traveling around Europe in a van. I was running out of money, so I got a job painting boats in a harbor. One day, I saw Picasso eating lunch at a restaurant. He was an old man, but I knew who he was. I was surprised because he was usually a private person.

I was with a friend, and he encouraged me to go talk to Picasso. I was shy, but my friend pushed me to do it. I showed Picasso my sketchbook and asked him to sign it. He agreed, and then he added a drawing on the page. It was a beautiful drawing, and I was happy.

After that, my friend suggested that I draw Picasso's portrait. I was nervous, but Picasso seemed to enjoy it. He acted out different faces and made me laugh. I tried to draw him, but it was hard. He was a good model, and he made me want to give up. But he finally stopped acting silly and let me draw him normally. I was surprised at how young he looked, even though he was 84 years old.

When I finished drawing, Picasso looked at it and nodded. He said it was good, and then he drew a portrait of me. It was very different from my drawing, but it was also very good. I was happy to have met Picasso and to have had him draw with me. It was a special experience that I will never forget.<|eot_id|>

Here is a simplified version of the text, suitable for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

**How shops try to get you to buy more**

Do you ever go to a shop and buy more things than you planned to? Shops use special tricks to make you spend more money. Let's see some of these tricks.

**Fresh and clean**

Shops make sure their fruit and vegetables are fresh and look nice. They put them near the entrance so you see them first. They also make the store smell nice, like freshly baked bread. This makes you feel like you're buying something healthy and fresh.

**Where things are placed**

Shops put important products in easy-to-reach places. They put things that are popular and make a lot of money near the front of the store. They also put things that are not as popular, but sell quickly, in easy-to-reach places.

**Making you walk around**

Shops put cheap things, like bread and sugar, in different parts of the store. This makes you walk past other things you might want to buy. Some shops even put their own brand products far from the entrance, so you have to look for them.

**Making things look good**

Some shops make their products look expensive and exclusive. They put limited amounts of things on the shelves, so you feel like you're getting something special.

**The price of things**

Shops put different prices on things to make you buy more. They might put cheap things next to expensive things, so you buy more of the cheap things. They might also put things on sale to make you buy them.

**Lighting and decorations**

Shops use lighting and decorations to make you feel good and want to buy things. They might use bright lights to make things look nice and appetizing.

**Guiding you through the store**

Shops use different carpets and patterns to guide you through the store. This makes you follow a certain path and look at things they want you to see.

**Advertising**

Some shops use big pictures and videos to make you want to buy things. They might even use special screens on trolleys to show you ads while you shop.

These are just a few tricks that shops use to make you buy more. Next time you go shopping, see if you can spot some of these tricks!<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>
Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

I was writing a book about adventure and I asked Robin for an interview. He said I could join him on his boat. I showed him how to climb and he showed me how to sail. We sailed to a beach and then climbed a big rock. Robin was very good at climbing. He had never done it before, but he did it well.

We built a friendship during that trip. Robin is a good leader. He always asked for our opinions. I liked that. But I found sailing boring. I like being on land. Robin liked fixing things on the boat. I felt useless sometimes.

When we got to Greenland, I was in charge of the group. It was hard for me to be responsible for Robin's safety. We climbed a big mountain together. Robin is not a good climber, but he tried hard. We had to turn back because it was too difficult. Robin was worried about the boat, but he wanted to try again.

We had a problem on the way back to the boat. Robin didn't wake me up for my shift. I felt he didn't trust me. But he said I was wrong. We became good friends on that trip. I found out that Robin is a kind and sensitive person.<|eot_id|>

Apples have been around for a long time. They come in many shapes, sizes, and colors. But we might lose some of these varieties. 

A long, long time ago, people ate apples. They even planted apple seeds in Britain. In Switzerland and Italy, people stored apple halves for the winter. These apples were not like the apples we know today. 

The Romans taught the French how to grow apples. They brought apples to Britain. The monks in Britain experimented and grew new apples. These apples are the ones we have today. 

In the past, people in Britain grew many types of apples. One type was called Pearmain. It was sweet and tasty. Another type was called Costard. It was used for cooking. 

In the 16th century, a king named Henry VIII wanted to learn about growing apples. He sent a man to France to learn. The man brought back special apple trees. 

People took apples with them when they traveled to new countries. They planted them and grew new trees. 

In the 19th century, a man named Johnny Appleseed planted many apple trees in America. He was very kind to animals and people. 

In the 19th century, a Quaker farmer found a new type of apple. It was called Delicious. It became very popular. 

Another famous apple was discovered by a woman named Granny Smith. She was a kind and hardworking person. 

Today, apples are grown all over the world. But many apples are the same. We need to save the different types of apples for the future.

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of English at the A2 level:

Advertising is not doing well. It's not just because of the economic crisis. Advertising has been declining since 1989, even before the crisis started. The problem is that advertising has not kept up with changes in the economy. Advertisers like to think about big groups of people and big media, but as there are more brands and media, the groups of people are smaller. Even big brands don't usually target the right people. This is the main reason why advertising is not working well.

Think about your own shopping habits. When you go to a supermarket, you might buy 30-50 things. Most of these things are not advertised brands. You might buy a few advertised brands, but not many. Over a year, you probably buy less than 400 different brands. This is different from the 32,500 brands that are advertised.

Most people don't buy many of the advertised brands. When you watch TV, you might see 1-2 commercials for brands you buy or might buy. For most people, this is about 6%. The other 94% of commercials are wasted.

You might think you are special and don't get influenced by advertising, but you are not alone. Most people think the same. The truth is that most people don't buy most of the advertised brands. Advertising has to reach many people to find the right ones, but it's hard to know who will respond.

Even with smart targeting, advertisers can't know exactly who will respond. They can try to reduce waste by targeting the right people, but they can't know for sure. This is different from face-to-face selling, where a salesman can know who will buy.

If advertisers knew exactly who would respond, they wouldn't need to use media advertising. They could just talk to those people directly. Any advertiser who can get 1-2% of the population to buy their product is doing well. The most effective way to reach those people might be through mass media, but to make advertising work again, advertisers need to target their message better than ever before.<|eot_id|>

**Leadership: What Makes a Good Leader?**

A leader is someone who inspires and helps others to work together. They show the way forward and make things happen. Leadership is not about being tall or smart. It's about being enthusiastic and believing in yourself.

A good leader should be able to speak clearly and confidently. They should be able to motivate others and make them want to work together. According to Pat Dixon, a leader should say "I believe" instead of "I think".

Anyone can be a leader, but it takes practice and learning. You can start by recognizing your own strengths and using them to help others. You can also learn from others who are good leaders.

A good leader makes their team feel important and valued. They listen to others and give them support. They also set goals and help their team achieve them.

You can improve your leadership skills by:

* Finding what you are passionate about and using it to inspire others
* Thinking of yourself as a leader and recognizing your strengths
* Trying different leadership styles and seeing what works best
* Setting goals and working to achieve them
* Practicing communication and learning from mistakes
* Being visible and accessible to others, but also knowing when to step back and let others take the lead.

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

**Taking Pictures of People**

People are the most interesting things to take pictures of. When someone is in a picture, it is usually more interesting than a picture without people. But it is hard to take good pictures of people. You need to think about their actions, gestures, and expressions.

**Group Shots**

When taking pictures of a group of people, don't make them stand in a straight line. Ask them to stand at different angles and distances. You can also take pictures from above or below to make it more interesting.

**Posing for Pictures**

People don't usually act naturally in front of a camera. They might look stiff and serious. To help them relax, suggest they sit or stand in a comfortable position. You can also ask them to put their hands in their pockets.

**Looking at the Camera**

When taking a picture, ask the person to look at the camera lens. This makes the picture more interesting. But they might get self-conscious, so remind them to look at the camera just before you take the picture.

**Candid Shots**

Instead of asking people to look at the camera, you can take pictures of them doing something else. This can make the picture more natural and interesting. You can also ask them to focus on something in the picture.

**Facial Expressions**

People's facial expressions tell us a lot about them. A happy face makes us happy, and a sad face makes us feel sorry. Look for natural expressions like smiling, frowning, or laughing.

**Background**

When taking pictures of people, think about the background. You can make the background interesting by using a wide-angle lens or moving the camera to a different position. Make sure the person is not too small in the picture.

**Interaction**

When taking pictures of people together, look for moments when they are interacting with each other. This can make the picture more interesting. You can also take pictures of people doing something together, like talking or playing.

**People and Places**

When taking pictures of people in a new place, try to show both the people and the place. Use a wide-angle lens and move back to get the whole scene in the picture. Ask the people to come closer to the camera so they are not too small in the picture.

**Posing or Not Posing**

When taking a picture, think about why you want to take it. If you want to remember someone, you might ask them to pose. But if you're taking a picture of a family, you might want to take a more natural picture.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>

Here is a rewritten version of the text at a level suitable for A2 learners:

**The Key to Success: Emotional Intelligence**

The way we work is changing. We are no longer judged just on how smart we are or how well we know our job. Now, we are also judged on how well we work with others. This is important because it helps us decide who will be successful and who will not.

The new way of thinking says that we all have the same level of intelligence and technical skills. What matters now is how we work with others. This includes being able to work together, be understanding, and communicate well.

In the past, we were taught that being good at school was important. But now, it's not enough. We need to be able to work well with others to be successful. This is called emotional intelligence.

Emotional intelligence is the ability to understand and control our own feelings and those of others. It's important because it helps us work together smoothly and achieve our goals.

Many companies are now teaching emotional intelligence to their employees. This is because it helps them work better together and be more successful. In the future, emotional intelligence will be even more important because jobs will change and we will need to be able to adapt.

The good news is that emotional intelligence can be learned and improved as we grow older. We can become better at understanding and controlling our emotions, and working well with others. This is important because the job market is changing and we need to be able to adapt.

Emotional intelligence is not a magic solution, but it can help us be more successful in our jobs and in life.<|eot_id|>

Here is a rewritten version of the text at a level suitable for A2 learners:

Acupuncture is a very old way of treating people. It comes from traditional Chinese medicine. This includes things like using herbs, massage, and special exercises. Acupuncture is used to help people feel better from many different problems. Doctors in the West are especially interested in using acupuncture to help with pain.

Traditional Chinese medicine thinks that our bodies have a special energy called Qi. This energy flows through our bodies along special paths called meridians. When the flow of Qi is blocked or weak, we might feel sick or weak. Acupuncturists try to find where the Qi is blocked and fix it.

Acupuncturists use very thin needles to help the Qi flow. They might also use heat or pressure to help the Qi move. People might feel a strange feeling when the needle is put in, but it's not usually painful.

Acupuncture can help with many kinds of pain, like back pain, headaches, and arthritis. Some people use it because they have tried other treatments and it's the only thing that helps. Acupuncturists think that it's better to treat the whole person, not just the pain.

Some doctors in the West don't believe in traditional Chinese medicine, but they do think that acupuncture can help with pain. They think it might work because it can stimulate nerves and make us feel better. Acupuncturists say that it can help people feel better and that it's safe.

It's important to find a good acupuncturist and to tell them about any other health problems you have. Some acupuncturists use acupuncture to help people feel better during surgery. This is a new idea that has been used in China for a long time.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>

If they write in all capital letters, it might mean they are trying to hide something. If their writing is very light, it might mean they are sensitive.

Here is a rewritten version of the text, simplified for a learner of English at the A2 level:

Chewing gum is very popular. People in the United States chew 12 million sticks every day. Let's find out how this old habit became a big business.

Chewing gum is not very good for you. It only has a few calories, but it is still a food, so it has to follow special rules. Most gum is made from chemicals and other things that make it taste good and feel smooth.

A long time ago, people in Greece chewed a special kind of gum made from a tree. Women liked to use it to clean their teeth and make their breath smell good. In America, people chewed a type of gum that came from spruce trees. This was the first gum that people sold in stores.

In the 1800s, people found a new kind of gum called chicle. It came from a special tree in Central America. This gum was better than the old kind because it was smoother and more fun to chew. Soon, many people started making gum from chicle.

But it's hard to find chicle, so people started making gum from other things. Today, most gum is made from chemicals and other ingredients. Some people still collect chicle, but it's hard work. They have to climb trees and deal with bugs and snakes.

Gum companies are always trying to make new and better gum. They add different flavors and textures to make it more fun. Some people like to chew gum because it helps keep their teeth clean. When you chew gum, it makes your mouth make more saliva, which helps clean your teeth.

Now, a lot of land in America is used to grow mint, which is used in many popular gum flavors.<|eot_id|>

E. Vinson Massif, Antarctica (4,897m)
I went to climb Vinson Massif with a group of people. We flew to Antarctica and climbed the mountain. It was very cold and windy, but we made it to the top.

F. Elbrus, Europe (5,633m)
I went to climb Elbrus with a group of people. We took a cable car to the top of the mountain and climbed up to the summit.

G. Carstensz Pyramid, Australasia (4,883m)
I went to climb Carstensz Pyramid with a group of people. We wanted to climb a new route and spend time with the local people. We climbed the mountain and reached the top.

Finally, it happened - the dam burst, and the water rushed down the river. The stream was deep and wild near our house. We were worried for three days, but the dam held, and the water went back down. Before the dam was built, the river would flood the nearby villages. Now, the dam keeps the water back, and we can enjoy the big clouds and the river's power. We feel safe in our valley."

There was a big building in a lumberyard by a lake. The building was old and had two floors. The outside walls were covered in sawdust. Some boys were bored and decided to go up to the roof. Michael, one of the boys, said, 'I dare you to jump down!' He jumped and laughed. The others were scared, but Michael encouraged them to jump too. They all jumped and laughed together.

After a while, one of the boys said, 'Let's do it again!' But Michael didn't want to. He was scared. The others waited for him to jump, but he didn't. They started to get tired and went down to the ground. Michael was left alone on the roof. He was thinking about how he was scared. He stayed there for a long time.

Finally, he closed his eyes, took a deep breath, and jumped. He landed on the sawdust and lay there for a while. The sun was setting and the workmen had gone home. Michael got up and went home. He was late for dinner and his stepmother was angry with him. He felt ashamed and didn't want to talk to anyone.

In Glasgow, there is a dentist's office called W. Lloyd Jerome's. It's a modern place with bright paintings on the walls and a blue couch where patients sit. Dr. Jerome wants to make people feel comfortable, not scared. He says many people only go to the dentist when they have a problem, because they are afraid. So, he tries to make the office feel relaxing and fun.

He doesn't wear a white coat like many dentists do. He thinks this makes people think of pain. Instead, he wants his patients to feel relaxed and enjoy their visit. He uses special machines that look like video game headsets to make patients feel more at ease. They can watch a movie while he checks their teeth.

The office also smells nice, like a perfume shop. Dr. Jerome wants people to feel like they're not at a regular dentist's office. He takes his job very seriously, but he also wants his patients to feel comfortable. He uses special tools that make cleaning their teeth feel gentle and painless.

Dr. Jerome went to the United States to learn new ways to make dentistry better. He found that when patients are happy, it makes it easier for the dentist to do their job. He wants to change the way dentists work in the UK to make it more friendly and relaxed.'

Note: I have simplified the vocabulary, sentence structure, and content to make it accessible to a learner of level A2. I have also removed some sentences and phrases that are not essential to the main idea of the text.<|eot_id|>

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

'Chocolate is a popular food that comes from South America. A long time ago, the Aztecs and Mayans grew a special tree called the cacao tree. They used its seeds to make a drink called chocolate. The drink was bitter and was used for special occasions.

Later, the Spanish came to South America and took some of the cacao seeds back to Europe. They added sugar and cinnamon to make the drink taste better. The rich people in Europe liked to drink chocolate in special houses called chocolate houses.

In the 1800s, a man named CJ van Houten invented a way to make chocolate powder. This made it easier to make chocolate bars. A company in England called Cadbury made a popular chocolate bar called Dairy Milk. They advertised it as a healthy snack and it became very popular.

Today, people in Britain eat a lot of chocolate, especially at Easter. Some chocolate companies are trying new ways to sell chocolate, like putting it in ice cream or drinks. But some farmers who grow the cacao seeds are having trouble because the price of the seeds is low. Maybe we should think about them when we eat our chocolate.'

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

Peter Cooke is 83 years old and very good at making things with shells. He likes to make small and beautiful objects like ornaments and flowers. He has been doing this for 10 years and is very happy with his work.

Peter shows me his apartment and his shells. He says, "Do you think I'm boring?" But he's not boring, he's enthusiastic. He loves what he does and it shows.

Some friends told Peter to have an exhibition in London, and 70% of the things he showed were sold. Now, he has another exhibition and the prices are very high - up to 2,000 for some things.

Peter says he doesn't decide how much his things cost. He just makes them because he loves it. He says, "I wish I had started doing this earlier, but I'm still making the best things I can."

Peter's work is very different from the usual shell decorations you find at the beach. He uses special glue and washing-up liquid to make his creations. He travels to different countries to find the most beautiful shells.

Some people write to Peter and say he's taking too many shells from the beach. But Peter says he only takes dead shells and doesn't disturb the living creatures. He thinks it's okay to collect shells if they're already empty.

Note: I simplified the vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure to make it more accessible to a learner of level A2. I also removed some details that were not essential to the main message of the text.<|eot_id|>

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

Kira Langer is a 15-year-old model. When she's not flying to nice places or being on magazine covers, she's studying for her school exams. I went to meet her at her agency. The receptionist said she would be late, so I was a bit worried. But when Kira arrived, she was smiling and sorry for being late. She was with her mom, who was proud of her daughter. Kira is very friendly and pretty. She's not used to being famous, but she's handling it well.

Kira's sister encouraged her to participate in a model competition. Kira didn't want to, but her sister sent in her photos anyway. Kira was surprised when she became a finalist and won the competition. Now she works for a big model agency in London.

Kira has to balance her school life with her modeling career. Her friends and teachers are proud of her, but some people at school are mean and say she thinks she's too important. Kira says this isn't true. She's just more confident now and can stand up for herself better.

As a model, Kira can't plan her social life because she might get a job at short notice. But her friends understand and don't complain. Kira has a great career ahead of her, and she's still young. If she wasn't a model, she would like to be a journalist like me.<|eot_id|>

Rachel Mills is a scientist who studies the ocean. She teaches and does research at the Oceanography Centre at Southampton University. She goes to the bottom of the ocean to study underwater volcanoes. She uses a special vehicle that looks like a small car. It's very small inside, and she has to stay there for 16 hours. If something goes wrong, she can press a button to get out quickly.

Rachel has gone on six dives. She went to a place in the Atlantic Ocean with a Russian team. They saw many underwater volcanoes, and it was very hot and smoky. When she's not at sea, Rachel works in her office. She teaches and does research to learn more about the "black smokers". This is what she calls underwater volcanoes. Water comes out of the rock and looks like black smoke.

Rachel was scared once when she went on a dive with Americans. There was a big explosion, and she thought she was going to die. But everything was okay, and she felt very relieved. Rachel loves going to the bottom of the ocean. It's an adventure. She feels happy and amazed when she sees the underwater volcanoes.

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

"I was very tired and dirty after my Inter-Rail holiday. My body was tired and my mind was confused from all the different languages, timetables, and currencies. I said 'never again' when I got home. But the next year, I said the same thing again. And the year after that, too.

The best thing about Inter-Rail was that I could travel anywhere in Europe for a month. I just needed to buy one ticket. I slept on the train and carried my things in a backpack. This made me feel free and carefree.

I didn't plan my trip very well. I just wanted to see new places and have fun. My friends and I went to France, and then we kept going to other countries. We didn't care about the cost. We just wanted to explore.

We didn't do much sightseeing. We just wanted to get to the next place. We were happy to see the view from the train station and enjoy the journey.

Traveling by train is a great way to see Europe. You can see many different places and meet new people. It's a fun and exciting experience. Even though it's not a big adventure, it's a good way to learn about Europe and have fun at the same time."
