Here is the rewritten text at a level A2 CEFR:

"When you travel to another country, it's very frustrating to find out that your luggage is missing. You might have to wear the same clothes for hours or days until the airline finds your bag. This can be especially bad if you're in a different climate or far from home and have to wear clothes that are not suitable. Airlines don't always tell us how many bags they lose, but it's true that sometimes they make mistakes. Even good airlines can lose luggage. The airline system is like this: they want you to arrive at the airport early so your bag can get on the plane. They also make sure you have enough time to change planes if you need to. But sometimes flights are delayed and this can cause problems with your luggage. Sometimes people make mistakes or things get lost. This can happen more often at big airports where many people are transferring planes. If you're going to a big airport, it's a good idea to take a direct flight and check in early. If you have to change planes, try to fly with the same airline and give yourself extra time to get to your next flight. Make sure to put your name and address on your luggage, both inside and out. If your luggage still goes missing, you need to tell the airline official at the airport and fill out a special form before you leave.<|eot_id|>

E. WAYNE MARSHALL Wayne Marshall, 32, started conducting by accident. He had to take over a show at short notice and did a good job. He is not afraid to tell the musicians what to do and knows what he likes.

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of English at level A2:

"Fun Theme Parks in Britain

We asked five families to visit different theme parks in Britain. They told us about their experiences.

Fun Island is a great park for young children. The rides are fun and safe for them. The staff are very helpful and the park is clean.

Wonderland is a good park for families. The rides are suitable for all ages. The staff are friendly and the park is well-organized.

Adventure World is a big park with many rides. The children loved the circus show and the river ride. The staff are nice and the park is clean.

The Great Park is good for younger children. The rides are not too scary. The park is open for only a few hours, so you need to plan your day.

Fantasy World is a big park with many rides. The children loved the roller-coaster and the slide. The staff are helpful, but some of them are not very friendly.

These are just a few examples of the many theme parks in Britain. Each park has its own special things to offer."

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A2 on the CEFR:

Five women talk about their businesses in the countryside.

Christine has a computer business. She and her husband moved to the country for a better life. She started her business at home and now has four employees. She likes working at home because it's cheaper and she can work in the evenings.

Maggy is a designer. She used to work in a museum but moved to the countryside after she got married. She started her own business making greeting cards. She works from home and sells her cards to museums. She likes being independent but sometimes misses talking to other designers.

Delia makes curtains. She started her business eight years ago and it was very successful. But then the economy got bad and she had to let some of her employees go. Now she works with her husband and some other people who work from home. She has to be careful with her money and make sure she doesn't overspend.

Tessa publishes children's books. She moved to the countryside for a better life and to be closer to nature. She works from home and has to deal with people in different time zones. She likes being able to work when she wants to, but sometimes it's hard to stop working.

Meg makes cakes and sells them by post. She started her business at home and now has a shop and six employees. She used to make all the cakes herself but now she has a baker and an assistant. She has to be careful with her money and make sure her business is profitable.

Note: I simplified the language, shortened the sentences, and removed some details to make it more accessible to a level A2 learner.<|eot_id|>

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of level A2:

Paul started playing the cello when he was a child. His father made him a cello because it was too expensive to buy one. Paul loved playing the cello and soon became very good at it. He even won a competition and became the principal cellist of the BBC Symphony Orchestra.

Huw, Paul's younger brother, started playing the piano when he was little. He also loved music and became a good pianist and composer. He even wrote his own string quartet.

Here is a simplified version of the text for a learner of English at the A2 level:

The National Trust helps take care of the countryside in Britain. I visited the Lleyn Peninsula in North Wales and talked to Gareth, a warden who works for the Trust. Gareth says that to be a good warden, you need to use common sense and be good with people.

Gareth grew up on a farm on the Lleyn Peninsula and worked there until he got married. When the National Trust was looking for a warden for the area, Gareth applied for the job. He got it because of his local knowledge and farming experience. He didn't need any special training.

Gareth is happy to still work on his family's farm and this helps him with his job. He can talk to farmers and understand their problems. He also knows how to do physical jobs like building fences and planting trees.

Gareth used to love collecting things like flowers and butterflies when he was a child. But now he sees that farming has affected the countryside. He thinks that farmers and conservationists used to argue a lot, but now they are working together.

Gareth's job is to make sure that the Trust's land is taken care of. He also helps with things like planting trees and meeting the farmers who work on the land. He likes seeing projects finished and talking to the public. But sometimes he gets annoyed with people who don't respect the land and the work that goes into taking care of it.

If you like being outside and want a job that uses common sense, you might want to apply to be a warden like Gareth. But it might take a while before there is a job available on the Lleyn Peninsula.<|eot_id|>

'England's Netball Captain

I met Kendra Slowinski, the captain of England's netball team. She is very busy preparing for the World Championships. She teaches at a school and then trains in a car park. She doesn't notice strange looks from people because she is focused on her movements.

Kendra wants to be the best she can be for the World Championships. She has a strict plan to get fit. This is her fourth time playing in the World Championships. This time, 27 countries will be playing. She is excited to have the support of the English crowd.

The team is ranked fourth in the world. Kendra knows it will be hard, but she is ready. She says that in the World Championships, you have to play every day and there is no rest. But you can still win even if you lose the first game.

Netball has become faster and more aggressive over the years. Kendra says that you don't train hard just to lose. After the game, the players are friends again.

The team is using new methods to test their fitness. Kendra thinks it's important to be a good leader and support her teammates. She has planned her netball career carefully and this will be her last big competition. She will probably cry when she leads her team in the opening ceremony.'

Note: I simplified the language, reduced the number of sentences, and used shorter paragraphs to make it easier to understand for a learner of level A2. Here is a rewritten version of the text at a level suitable for A2 learners:

Some children are very good at music. It's not always easy to know how to help them develop their talent. Some parents might not notice their child's musical ability until they get upset or behave badly. Schools are good at helping children who are good at other subjects, but music schools are special because they understand and support children who are very good at music.

There are five music schools in Britain that are especially for children who are good at music. These schools have professional musicians who help the children learn and practice. The children spend most of their day doing music activities, like playing instruments, singing, or conducting. They also have some time for regular subjects like English, maths, and science.

The schools are small and have a lot of teachers, so the children get a lot of attention. Most children who go to these schools live at the school, which means they are with other children who like music just like them. This can be helpful for some children.

However, there are some problems. The schools are expensive, and it can be hard for some families to afford the fees. Some parents might not want their children to go to boarding school, especially when they are very young. The schools try to help by offering scholarships and other ways to make it more affordable.

Some people think that sending children to music school too early can be bad for them. They might feel too much pressure and stress. The schools try to make sure that the children are happy and healthy, and they offer help if they need it.

Some people think that music schools are not the best choice for every child. Some children are good at music and other subjects, and they might do well in a regular school with a good music program. There are also music colleges that offer music lessons on Saturdays, which might be a good option for some families.<|eot_id|>

Do you want to publish your writing? Margaret Stubbs can help. Many people write to her and ask, 'Where should I send my story?' First, you need to learn about the market and the publishers. You also need to practice your writing. To do this, read a lot of books and magazines. Visit your local library and bookstores. This will help you understand what kind of writing publishers want.

If you're not sure what you want to write, start by finding out what types of stories magazines are looking for. For example, if you like writing love stories, find out which magazines publish them. Read some recent issues and see what kind of stories they like. This will help you understand what readers want.

Don't send your work to publishers too soon. Most new writers are not ready yet. Keep writing and improving your skills. Don't show your work to others until you're happy with it. Every successful writer has had many rejections before they were published. To improve, take a writing course or join a writers' group. Write every day if you can.

When he saw the restaurant, it was in bad shape. But John liked it because it reminded him of his childhood. He grew up with a single mother who worked hard. Gary wasn't good at school, but he loved cooking. By the time he was 15, he was as good as the other cooks in the restaurant. He even got to be in charge sometimes. John knew Gary would go into cooking because he had a talent for it.

Gary started playing the drums and now has his own band. John told him to focus on one thing at a time, not to chase two things at once. Gary went to cooking school at 17 and did very well. He was preparing meals for his classmates in just one hour! John is very proud of Gary's success on TV. He thinks Gary listened to his advice and worked hard to achieve his goals.

Here is the simplified text for a learner of English at the A2 level:

People love dolphins. They are very smart and can understand human emotions. We see them in movies and at the seaside. But did you know that dolphins are in trouble? Mark Simmonds tells us about the problems they face.

There are many types of dolphins. Some live in the open sea, and we don't know much about them. Others live near our coastlines. There used to be many bottlenose dolphins and harbour porpoises near our coast, but now there are very few. The ones that are left are often sick or hurt.

Dolphins have a hard time finding food because there is not enough fish in the sea. Fishermen's nets can also hurt them. Sometimes dolphins get caught in the nets and die. They can also eat food that is bad for them, like old fish or chemicals in the water.

Female dolphins can pass these bad things to their babies through their milk. This can be very dangerous for the babies. Noise pollution from ships and other things can also disturb dolphins. We don't know exactly how, but it might be very bad for them.

We should take care of dolphins and their homes. We can do this by not polluting the sea and by not overfishing. We should also make sure that fishermen's nets are safe for dolphins.<|eot_id|>

Here is a simplified version of the text, suitable for a learner of English at level A2:

**First Impressions are Important**

When we meet someone for the first time, we make an impression of them in just a few minutes. We notice how they dress, their body language, and how they speak. We also notice if they are on time or late.

Mary Pearce wanted to be a teacher. She worked hard and got a degree. She went to an interview at a school, but she didn't get the job. The Head Teacher said, "If someone doesn't take care of themselves, what kind of teacher will they be?"

Simon Grant, a hotel manager, says, "When we look good, we feel good. And when we feel good, we do a good job." Many people don't realize how important it is to look professional.

Janet Goodwood worked in an office for 10 years, but she didn't get a promotion. The Director of Personnel told her she didn't look like an office manager. He said she should change her clothes before applying again.

Our body language and facial expressions also matter. A psychologist found that 55% of what we say comes from our facial expressions. If our words and facial expressions don't match, the listener will believe the facial expression.

It's also important not to be too eager or too desperate for a job. Sheila Rice got a job offer, but she was too excited. The boss knew she would accept the job, so he offered her a lower salary.

Finally, it's important to know about the company before an interview. You can read the annual report to learn about the company's projects. You can also prepare some questions to ask during the interview.

Note: I removed some sentences and paragraphs to make the text shorter and easier to understand. I also used simpler vocabulary and sentence structures to make it more accessible to a learner at level A2.<|eot_id|>

Darius (runner) - I like sports. I played many sports when I was young, but I was best at football and running. If my friends ask me to go out the night before a big run, I have to say no.

Gabriel (surfer) - The surfing community is small, so I see the same people at competitions. Surfers are very serious and the best waves are usually early in the morning. You have to give up late nights to get good waves. I don't mind, but I do like sleeping in. It's worth it because it helps me win competitions. After I win, I like to have a big celebration and go on a nice trip.

Dieter (yacht racer) - It's fun to be on a boat with my friends. We always celebrate our wins in a big way. People sometimes say we're silly when we're out having fun, but we don't try to get attention. Reporters like to write about where we go out and what we do there more than about how well we did in the race. I'm away from home for eight months a year, so it's nice to come back and do normal things with my friends. I'm known in the sailing world, but nobody really recognizes me in the street. I like getting letters from fans and I always reply.

Tomas (tennis player) - It's great to walk onto the court and feel like the crowd is supporting me. Sometimes it gets crazy with too many people around, but I like being recognized by fans when I'm out shopping. It's not all good, though. My last girlfriend didn't like it when I got too much attention from female fans. As a tennis player, you have to travel a lot and make sacrifices. Parents have different opinions about what is good or bad for their children. Some parents are worried about what they give their children to eat. They want to teach their children to make good choices, but it's hard when there are so many advertisements trying to influence them. 

Some parents feel stressed when they are shopping with their children. They have to decide what to buy and what not to buy. They might feel guilty if they say no to their children's requests. 

One mother says she talks to her children about food and helps them understand what is good and what is not. She is happy that her children are critical of advertisements. 

Some parents admit that they are not consistent in their answers to their children's requests. They might say no to one thing, but yes to another. It's hard to be consistent, especially when children are asking for things they want.

Supermarkets could make it easier for parents and children to shop together. They could remove sweets from the checkout area or provide a play area for children. This might make parents happy and encourage them to shop more often.<|eot_id|>

"Ice Skating

Ice skating has been around for a very long time. People used to make skates from animal bones. The first skates were made of bone and were used until people started using iron. In some countries, ice skating was important for the rich people. 

In the past, ice skating was only for special people. But then a girl named Sonja Henie started skating in a new way. She made ice skating popular again. Now, ice skating is a mix of art and sport. 

To start ice skating, you need to balance and control. You need to bend your knees and lean forward a little. You should also relax and not be stiff. 

When you start skating, you should put your feet together and push off with one foot. Then, move the other foot a little bit. If you practice, you can get better and better. 

It's important to know how to fall safely. Even good skaters fall sometimes. To get up, you need to get on your knees and then stand up. 

There are different ways to skate, like figure skating and speed skating. But first, you should learn the basics of figure skating. 

To be a good skater, you need to practice regularly. You should also warm up before you skate and do exercises to loosen up your body. 

Ice skating is good for your body. It helps you balance, move well, and feel relaxed. It's also good for your heart and lungs. You can even do it with swimming or jogging to stay healthy and fit."<|eot_id|>

My favorite place in England is the Trough of Bowland. It's a big open area with no many people. I like the feeling of being alone. I found this place by chance when I was a student, and I go back every year. It's a special place for me because I can be alone and think.

I bought a house in England called Glenthorne. It's a peaceful place where I can relax and remember my childhood. I used to live in Sri Lanka, but I went to school in Devon, England. I loved cycling around the countryside and visiting the village. There was one place we never rode past because it was said that if you went down the driveway, you would never come back. Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2:

Many people are getting taller. Chris Greener is the tallest man in Britain. He is 228 cm tall. This is because people's average height is growing by one centimetre every decade.

In the past, people ate different foods. They ate fruits, vegetables, and meat. This made them strong and healthy. But then, people started farming. This meant they ate more carbohydrates like bread and rice. This was not good for their health.

For a long time, people did not eat well. They were not as tall or as healthy as their ancestors. But now, some countries are eating better. This means people are getting taller again. In some countries, the average height is 180 cm or more.

But there is a problem. Buildings and cars are not getting taller or bigger. This means people have less space. Some scientists think that people will stop growing taller soon. They think it will happen because of the way we eat and the climate.

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 CEFR:

Some newspapers in the UK take pictures of famous people without their permission. This is not what the newspapers' rules say they should do. Most people who are famous don't want their private moments to be shown in the newspapers. But very few of them go to the Press Complaints Commission (PCC) to complain. The PCC is meant to help with problems like this.

The PCC should look into some of these cases, but it rarely does. The PCC should also look into a recent story about a famous pop star's private life. The pop star didn't complain, but someone else should have. 

The PCC could take on a bigger role and stop newspapers from publishing private pictures. But this would be difficult. The PCC would have to decide which pictures are private and which are not. Celebrities might get upset if the PCC doesn't look into all the stories about them. 

There are many problems with the PCC taking on this role. How would it decide which cases to look into? Would it ask the person involved to complain? If they don't want to complain, should the PCC still investigate? 

It's hard to find a solution to this problem.<|eot_id|>

Some people seem very confident, but most of them say it's something they learned. Nina Hathway asked five people how they did it. 

A) Jenny was shy when she was young. She helped out at her daughter's school and did well. Someone suggested she take a course at university. She was nervous at first, but she became more outgoing. 

B) Michaela's father got sick and she had to take over the family business. She was scared and got angry. She learned that confidence comes from believing in yourself. When she's worried, she tells herself she has nothing to lose. 

C) Lisa is a TV presenter. People think she's confident, but she's really nervous. She learned to look confident because it's important for her job. She also learned that everyone gets nervous sometimes, and talking to friendly people makes her feel calmer.

E) Kim used to be too scared to speak up in meetings. She started speaking up and even started talking in public. She told herself that it's normal to be a little scared and that she could do it. She also wrote down some notes to help her feel more confident.

The secret to confidence is to believe in yourself and not be afraid of trying new things.<|eot_id|>

Do you like shopping? People have different ways of shopping. Some people love it, and some people don't like it at all. Let's see who you are.

A. Melanie, 22, dancer: I love shopping! I like to buy things when I have money. I can't resist buying things when they're on sale.

B. Brenda, 40, office manager: I don't like shopping. My husband buys food for our family. I don't like buying clothes for myself. When I do buy something, I feel guilty.

C. Juliet, 28, personnel manager: I only buy what I need. I don't like shopping. I'd rather do something else.

D. Anita, 35, TV producer: I like to shop sometimes. I know what I want and I find it quickly.

E. Lizzie, 41, secretary: I don't like shopping at all. I don't like buying clothes. I'm lucky because my clothes are often given to me.

F. Lisa, 22, actress: I like shopping with my friends. We go out and sometimes we buy things.

G. Suki, 26, art gallery assistant: I'm careful when I shop. I don't buy much. Sometimes I shop to cheer myself up, but it doesn't always work.

H. Ann-Marie, 29, nursery worker: I love shopping, but only on certain days. I like to find good deals.

I. Linda, 32, restaurant manager: I don't like shopping. I work in the city, so I don't want to go shopping. When I have to, I just buy what I need.

Gallery Restaurant

Do you like to write stories? Now is your chance to win some money and have your story published! Keep Writing magazine is running a competition for writers. The winner will get 1,000 and their story will be printed in the magazine. Ten other winners will get 100.

The judges, who are all experts in writing, are looking for stories that are interesting and original. They want to read about things that happen in real life, but with a twist. They want to be surprised!

Here are some tips to help you write a good story:

* Write about what you know. This is what most people do.
* Make the story interesting by doing something new and unexpected.
* Make sure you get the facts right. Don't write about things you're not sure about.
* Start the story in an exciting way and end it with a surprise.
* Make the people in your story come alive by using good words.

Your story must be between 2,000 and 2,500 words, typed on one side of the paper, double-spaced. You must also include an application form with your story. Don't send it by fax or email. You can't send it back to us once it's been sent.

Remember, your story can't have been published anywhere else before. If you win, you must agree to have your story printed in our magazine.

The closing date is July 30th. We will contact the winner within a month of this date. Good luck!<|eot_id|>

Wansford Station

'Every year, many people climb Ben Nevis in Scotland. It's a big mountain, and it can be very cold because it's in the north. My friend Keith went climbing there for the first time. He went up the north side of the mountain to a place called Tower Ridge. It's a long way up - 600 metres. They planned to stay in a special place on the mountain for three days. They took big tents, warm sleeping bags, and special shoes with spikes. You need these things because the snow is very hard and slippery.

Even though some of the group were very experienced, they brought safety things like lights, helmets, and extra clothes. The weather was good, but they were still a little worried. Ben Nevis is a big challenge in the winter.

The path got steeper and my legs felt heavy. I was the weakest one, so I had to stop more often. The others would wait for me and then we would continue. I promised myself to train more before climbing again.

After 200 metres, we reached Tower Ridge. It's very narrow and the mountain drops down very far on both sides. We had to be very careful and slow. After seven hours, we reached the top. On a clear day, you can see the sea and even a small island called Skye. But on this day, there was mist.

Going down the mountain can be just as hard as going up. You need to read the map carefully, or you might get lost. I was glad we took turns doing this job. When I was safe in my tent, I finally felt happy about the experience. I made it to the top!'<|eot_id|>

A new furniture shop called Homestyle opened at midnight last Thursday. Many people went there to buy things. There were special deals on things like sofas and beds. The police had to come because there was a big crowd and people were getting angry. Some people were waiting in line to get in, but others were getting impatient and didn't want to wait. There was also a problem with cars trying to park. Some people even left their cars in the middle of the road and walked to the shop. This blocked the road. One customer, Jenny, said she waited three hours to get in, but she didn't have time to buy what she wanted. The staff were calm and explained what was happening. They had to close the shop because it wasn't safe. Jenny will go back to the shop when it reopens, but she doesn't want to wait in line again.

Here is the simplified text, suitable for a learner of English at level A2:

**The Short Story Society**

The Short Story Society is a group that helps writers in the UK. It was started in 1899 and is now one of the most active arts groups in the country.

**Magazines**

We publish two magazines: the Short Story Review and Short Story News. The Review has short stories from famous British writers and also helps new writers get their work published. Short Story News has interviews with writers and information about writing events, competitions, and festivals.

**Competition**

We have a big writing competition every year. Anyone aged 18 or over can enter. You can write about anything you like, and your story should be between 1,000 and 1,500 words long. There is no fee to enter if you are a member of the Society. The best stories will be published in a book. The winner gets a contract to publish their own book of stories.

**Education**

We have been teaching writing in schools for nearly 30 years. We help children and teachers with their writing and build their confidence. We also have a competition for young writers aged 11-18. The winners get prizes and can attend a writing course taught by professional writers.

**The Writers' Cafe**

The Writers' Cafe is a relaxed and friendly place to meet other writers and look at our magazines. We serve vegetarian food and drinks. We also have exhibitions, courses, and readings. It's located in the heart of London and is open from 11 am to 10 pm Monday to Friday and 11 am to 8 pm on Saturday. Society members get discounts on some products and events.

**Join the Society**

Anyone aged 18 or over can join the Short Story Society. If you're interested, click here to fill out a registration form.<|eot_id|>

|end_header_id|>

'Tanya Streeter is a very good free-diver. She holds four world records. Free-diving is a sport where people swim deep into the ocean without breathing equipment. In 2003, Tanya made history by diving 120 meters deep and coming back up without help. She held her breath for over three minutes, which is very long. A team of safety divers watched her.

Some people think free-diving is too dangerous, but Tanya says safety is the most important thing. She trains every day, both on land and in the water. She uses a bike to make her heart stronger. She doesn't run because she doesn't want to hurt her knees. Instead, she walks quickly to stay fit.

Tanya travels to different places to practice her dives. She does 14 dives in four weeks, with a day off in between. She doesn't want to get tired because it could ruin her training.

When Tanya is not training, she goes to public events to talk about sports products. She also helps environmental organizations by doing research and making films. Tanya grew up on a Caribbean island and loved swimming and exploring the ocean. She says her life is like living her childhood dreams.

Tanya is famous in some countries, so people listen to her when she talks about environmental issues. She plans to keep breaking her own records and says she won't retire from free-diving for a long time.'

Here is the simplified text, suitable for a learner of English at level A2 (CEFR):

'Journey on the Douro River

A special boat, the MV Lady Ivy May, takes people on a trip along the Douro River in Portugal. The boat has 160 cabins with private bathrooms. On the boat, there is a sun deck, a lounge, a bar, a restaurant, a shop, and a library.

Day 1: We fly from London to Oporto. Our guide will meet us and take us to the boat. We will stay on the boat tonight.

Day 2: We will visit Oporto in the morning. Then we will go back to the boat and sail to Entre-os-Rios. This part of the trip takes four hours.

Day 3: We will continue sailing up the river. We will stop at Peso da Regua in the evening. We will eat dinner and try some local food and drink.

Day 4: After breakfast, we will go to the old town of Lamego. We will visit a big church, some smaller churches, and a museum. The museum is in an old palace and has many paintings, tapestries, and sculptures. Then we will go back to the boat and sail to Tua.

Day 5: The river gets very narrow. We might be able to go by a smaller boat to the Spanish border. If not, we will take a bus back to Tua.

Day 6: We will go to Sao Joao da Pesqueira to see a beautiful view. Then we will go back to the boat for lunch and take a train ride through the countryside to Regua.

Day 7: We will visit Vila Real and then go back to the boat for lunch. Then we will sail back down the river to Oporto.

Day 8: We will arrive in Oporto in the morning and have some free time to explore and shop. Then we will fly back to London.'<|eot_id|>

Norwich is a city in East Anglia, England. It has been a place to live for over 2,000 years. It started as a small village near a river. In 1066, it was one of the biggest towns in England. Norwich has two big churches and a mosque. People from different religions like to come here.

One of the churches is very old. It was built in 1095 and is 900 years old. Norwich celebrated its 800th birthday in 1994. This was a special year because it got a special permission from the king to be a city and make its own decisions.

Norwich is a small city with 150,000 people. But it was once very big and important. In the past, there were many churches and pubs. Today, there are fewer, but there are still many things to do. Recently, the city built a new shopping centre called 'The Castle Mall'. Before it was built, there was a big hole in the city for two years. 'Albuquerque Balloon Festival

Every year, the city of Albuquerque in the United States has a big balloon festival. The sky turns into a rainbow of colors. The first festival was in 1972 to celebrate a radio station's 50th birthday. There were only a few balloons, but now there are over 1,000 from all around the world!

What to See

At night, the pilots make their balloons glow, and you can take great photos. But you need to come early or late to see this. During the day, you can walk around the balloons and talk to the pilots. There are balloons in all shapes and sizes, even animals and cartoon characters!

You can also take a ride in a balloon over the desert or go on a cable car to the top of the nearby mountains. There are many other things to do, like balloon races and fireworks.

Important Tips

Buy your ticket online to avoid waiting in line. Wear thin clothes and bring sunglasses, suncream, and a flashlight. Don't forget your camera and extra film if you're not using a digital camera.

He was worried about her being sick. Samuel Pepys liked books, music, plays, card games, and parties with good food and fun. He was a busy person who had important jobs, like being a politician and helping the navy.'

Here is the simplified text for a learner of level A2 on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR):

A LONG TIME AGO, PEOPLE CAME TO ALASKA TO FIND GOLD. THEY BUILT A TOWN CALLED IDITAROD. IT GREW FAST AND BECAME A BIG CITY. BUT IN THE WINTER, IT WAS HARD TO GET SUPPLIES TO THE TOWN. SO, PEOPLE BUILT A SPECIAL PATH FOR DOGS TO PULL SLEDGES. THEY WOULD BRING FOOD, CLOTHES, AND LETTERS TO THE PEOPLE LIVING THERE. THIS PATH WAS CALLED THE IDITAROD TRAIL.

THE DOGS WOULD TAKE ABOUT THREE WEEKS TO GET TO THE OTHER SIDE. THEY WOULD STOP AT SPECIAL HOUSES WHERE THE DRIVERS COULD REST AND EAT. THE TRAIL WAS USED FOR A LONG TIME, BUT THEN PLANES CAME AND PEOPLE STARTED TO USE THEM INSTEAD.

BUT IN 1925, A BAD DISEASE CALLED DIPHTHERIA SPREAD IN A TOWN CALLED NOME. THE ONLY WAY TO CURE IT WAS WITH A SPECIAL MEDICINE, BUT IT WAS FAR AWAY. PLANE PILOTS WERE NOT SURE IF THEY COULD FLY IN THE COLD WEATHER, SO THEY DECIDED TO USE DOGS AGAIN. IT TOOK 20 TEAMS OF DOGS SIX DAYS TO GET THE MEDICINE TO NOME. A DOG NAMED BALTO WAS VERY BRAVE AND HELPED SAVE THE DAY.

NOW, EVERY YEAR, PEOPLE HAVE A DOG SLED RACE FROM ANCHORAGE TO NOME, FOLLOWING THE SAME PATH AS THE DOGS DID IN 1925. IT'S CALLED THE IDITAROD RACE AND IS KNOWN AS "THE LAST GREAT RACE ON EARTH".<|eot_id|>

'Welcome to Antarctica Sightseeing Flights! We take tourists on a big plane from Sydney, Australia to see Antarctica and back. The flight is 12 hours long. We usually see ice and icebergs after four hours, and then we spend four hours flying over Antarctica. The rest of the time, we fly back home. 

We have experts on board who tell us about Antarctica and answer our questions. You can see what the pilot sees through a special camera on the plane. 

You will get two boarding passes. Halfway through the flight, you will move to a different seat. If you are in business or first class, you will have a window seat for half the flight and a seat next to the window for the other half. If you are in economy, you will have a window seat or a seat next to the window for half the flight and a seat at the end of the row for the other half. 

You can get up and move around the plane while we are flying over Antarctica. The pilot flies in special patterns to make sure everyone can see the amazing sights. 

What if it's bad weather? We have a plan to make sure we can still see the sights. 

Can I see penguins and other animals? Unfortunately, they live too far down and we can't see them clearly. We don't land on Antarctica because it's not good for the environment. If you want to see Antarctic animals, you need to go on a boat tour. 

Can I take pictures? Yes, you can take as many pictures as you like! We even have some fun activities on the plane where you can try on special cold-weather clothes.'<|eot_id|>

He had trouble with the traditional drawing classes, but he kept painting. When he was a bit older, the Italian government gave him money to study art in Italy. He loved the colors and light in Italy and wanted to put that in his paintings. He paints with thin layers of color, from light to dark. He says it's a secret because he doesn't know what the final result will be.

Aitchison is very good at painting. He says anyone can buy the colors, but it's about choosing the right colors and putting them together. He doesn't make drawings before he starts painting. If he does, he might get bored and not finish the painting. Instead, he changes his paintings many times before they are finished.

Aitchison likes to paint people, but he prefers it when they don't ask to see the painting while he's working on it. If they get worried and want to look, he can't focus. He doesn't follow any special style or tradition in his painting. He just paints the way he likes. Even though he's not part of the Scottish art scene, his work still inspires young British painters."

I'm having a great holiday in Australia. When we got here, the weather was bad and it was cold. But now it's better and we go to the beach every day. This week, we are staying in Sydney. Next week, we will go to the Great Barrier Reef. The water is very warm, so I like swimming there. The fish are different colors: red, yellow, purple! Australia is very beautiful. We don't want to go home yet! See you at the end of September. Sue'

I made the following changes to simplify the text:

* Simplified vocabulary: "having a good holiday" instead of "having a good holiday in Australia", "bad weather" instead of "the weather was bad", "going to the beach every day" instead of "we go to the beach every day", "staying in Sydney" instead of "we are staying in Sydney", "the water was so warm" instead of "the water was warm", "different colors" instead of "all different"
* Reduced sentence complexity: Combined some sentences to make them shorter and easier to understand.<|eot_id|>
